name: spack
description:
Spack is a multi-platform package manager that builds and installs
multiple versions and configurations of software. It works on Linux,
macOS, and many supercomputers. Spack is non-destructive: installing a
new version of a package does not break existing installations, so many
configurations of the same package can coexist.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: py-ipython
dependencies.description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.

dependencies.name: clingo-bootstrap
dependencies.description: Clingo with some options used for bootstrapping

dependencies.name: bzip2
dependencies.description:
bzip2 is a freely available, patent free high-quality data compressor.
It typically compresses files to within 10% to 15% of the best available
techniques (the PPM family of statistical compressors), whilst being
around twice as fast at compression and six times faster at
decompression.

dependencies.name: gzip
dependencies.description:
GNU Gzip is a popular data compression program originally written by
Jean-loup Gailly for the GNU project.

dependencies.name: tar
dependencies.description:
GNU Tar provides the ability to create tar archives, as well as various
other kinds of manipulation.

dependencies.name: unzip
dependencies.description: Unzip is a compression and file packaging/archive utility.

dependencies.name: xz
dependencies.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.

dependencies.name: zstd
dependencies.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.

dependencies.name: bash
dependencies.description: The GNU Project's Bourne Again SHell.

dependencies.name: file
dependencies.description:
The file command is "a file type guesser", that is, a command-line tool
that tells you in words what kind of data a file contains

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: patch
dependencies.description:
Patch takes a patch file containing a difference listing produced by the
diff program and applies those differences to one or more original
files, producing patched versions.

dependencies.name: ccache
dependencies.description:
ccache is a compiler cache. It speeds up recompilation by caching
previous compilations and detecting when the same compilation is being
done again.

dependencies.name: curl
dependencies.description:
cURL is an open source command line tool and library for transferring
data with URL syntax

dependencies.name: git
dependencies.description:
Git is a free and open source distributed version control system
designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with
speed and efficiency.

dependencies.name: mercurial
dependencies.description: Mercurial is a free, distributed source control management tool.

dependencies.name: subversion
dependencies.description: Apache Subversion - an open source version control system.

dependencies.name: binutils
dependencies.description: GNU binutils, which contain the linker, assembler, objdump and others

dependencies.name: gnupg
dependencies.description: GNU Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) package.

dependencies.name: patchelf
dependencies.description:
PatchELF is a small utility to modify the dynamic linker and RPATH of
ELF executables.

dependencies.name: py-boto3
dependencies.description: The AWS SDK for Python.

dependencies.name: py-isort
dependencies.description: A Python utility / library to sort Python imports.

dependencies.name: py-mypy
dependencies.description: Optional static typing for Python.

dependencies.name: py-black
dependencies.description:
Black is the uncompromising Python code formatter. By using it, you
agree to cede control over minutiae of hand-formatting. In return, Black
gives you speed, determinism, and freedom from pycodestyle nagging about
formatting.

dependencies.name: py-flake8
dependencies.description:
Flake8 is a wrapper around PyFlakes, pep8 and Ned Batchelder's McCabe
script.

dependencies.name: py-sphinx
dependencies.description: Sphinx Documentation Generator.

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-programoutput
dependencies.description:
A Sphinx extension to literally insert the output of arbitrary commands
into documents, helping you to keep your command examples up to date.

dependencies.name: py-sphinx-rtd-theme
dependencies.description: ReadTheDocs.org theme for Sphinx.

dependencies.name: graphviz
dependencies.description: Graph Visualization Software
